    • Constructor Detail

      • MathParser

        public MathParser()
        Creates and initialise MathParser

        This constructor initialise the object using DefaultContextBuilder.createDefault() to create a default context

      • MathParser

        public MathParser(Context context)
        Creates and initialise the MathParser

        This constructor allow to specify a custom Context

        Parameters:
        context - The context to associate with

      • MathParser

        public MathParser(ContextBuilder contextBuilder)
        Creates and initialise the MathParser

        This constructor requires a builder to create its context

        Parameters:
        contextBuilder - The builder to use to create the context

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public Expression execute(Expression infix)
                   throws ExpressionException,
                          ConfigException
        Executes a mathematical expression in infix notation

        This method uses toPostfix(Expression) and executePostfix(Expression) to first convert the string to postfix notation and then execute it

        Parameters:
        infix - The input stack containing the expression to execute
        Returns:
        An object containing the result of the execution of the expression
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression
        ConfigException - In case of misconfiguration of the parser

      • execute

        public Expression execute(java.lang.String strInfix)
                   throws ExpressionException,
                          ConfigException
        Executes a mathematical expression in infix notation

        This method uses toPostfix(Expression) and executePostfix(Expression) to first convert the string to postfix notation and then execute it

        Parameters:
        strInfix - The input stack containing the expression to execute
        Returns:
        An object containing the result of the execution of the expression
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression
        ConfigException - In case of misconfiguration of the parser

      • executePostfix

        public Expression executePostfix(Expression postfix)
                          throws ExpressionException
        Executes a postfix-notation mathematical expression

        The method can also minimise an expression which means execute it but without resolving variables

        Parameters:
        postfix - The input stack containing the expression to execute
        Returns:
        An object containing the result of the execution of the expression
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression

      • getContext

        public Context getContext()
        Gets the current working context
        Returns:
        The current working context

      • minimise

        public Expression minimise(Expression postfix)
                    throws ExpressionException
        Minimise an expression until only variables and non-minimizable expression are left
        Parameters:
        postfix - The input expression to be minimised
        Returns:
        An object containing a mathematically equivalent expression to the input one, but minimised
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression

      • toPostfix

        public Expression toPostfix(Expression infix)
                     throws ExpressionException,
                            ConfigException
        Infix-to-postfix converter
        Parameters:
        infix - The mathematical expression to convert
        Returns:
        A stack containing the converted object to postfix notation
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression
        ConfigException - In case of misconfiguration of MathParser

      • toPostfix

        public Expression toPostfix(java.lang.String strInfix)
                     throws ExpressionException,
                            ConfigException
        Infix-to-postfix converter
        Parameters:
        strInfix - The mathematical expression to convert
        Returns:
        A stack containing the converted object to postfix notation
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression
        ConfigException - In case of misconfiguration of MathParser

      • executePostfix

        protected Expression executePostfix(CmplxExpression postfix,
                        boolean minimize)
                             throws ExpressionException
        Executes a postfix-notation mathematical expression

        The method can also minimise an expression which means execute it but without resolving variables

        Parameters:
        postfix - The input stack containing the expression to execute
        minimize - Indicates if the expression should only be minimised.
        Returns:
        An object containing the result of the execution of the expression
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression

      • minimize

        protected Expression minimize(CmplxExpression postfix)
                       throws ExpressionException
        Minimise an expression until only variables and non-minimizable expression are left
        Parameters:
        postfix - The input expression to be minimised
        Returns:
        An object containing a mathematically equivalent expression to the input one, but minimised
        Throws:
        ExpressionException - In case of bad input expression
